Note: Griffey's rookie year, when he spent most of the season as the Mariners starting centerfielder despite being just 19 years old- the youngest player in the majors.
He is the first Mariner elected as an All-Star starter, and he and his dad become the first father-son duo to hit back-to-back home runs.
Griffey continues to develop and has his best season yet, leading the Mariners to their first-ever winning season.
Griffey puts together another strong season, highlighted by earning All-Star Game MVP honors after a 3-for-3 performance, including a home run.
Griffey suffered a severe wrist injury on May 26, 1995, while making a leaping catch into the outfield wall. It sidelined him until mid-August
His best home-run seasons were 1997 and 1998, when he hit 56 each year

Griffey was traded to Cincinnati following the 1999 Mariners season, having hit 398 homers in 11 years here
Injuries forced Griffey to miss 260 out of 486 games with the Reds from 2002-2004
Griffey was traded during the 2008 season and hit three homers with the White Sox
